```{r setup}
library(geslaR)
```

Using the `query_gesla()` function here.

```{r}
da <- query_gesla(country = "ATA", year = 2018)
class(da)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
da |>
    count(year)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
da |>
    count(year) |>
    collect()
```
